results.deck: City Interactive is a international publisher and possibly one of the largest Polish video game developers having released numerous titles for both PC and consoles. In 2002, City Interactive was created by Lemon Interactive together with two other development studios -- Tatanka and We Open Eyes.
results.description:
The people behind City Interactive have been responsible for titles such as Project Earth, which was well received. Even though City Interactive creates and publishes games for consoles (mostly Nintendo systems), City Interactive's main focus is creating and publishing games for personal computers using high-end technology and pushing the development budget to the limit.

When the publishing studio and two video game studios got merged together -- creating City Interactive, City decided to expand the companies already broad-scope activity even more. Their long-term expansion strategy was a success, and today City Interactive is present in the USA, Australia and the majorities of European counties, including Germany, the United Kingdom and Russia. In 2008, they also began to expand to South America.

With good marketing campaigns and high quality work, City Interactive has managed to stay focused on progression and have now become the largest software entertainment company in Poland. Thanks to great quality-to-price ratio, as well as an excellent and broad spectrum of game titles, City Interactive has acquired a strong position in the video game business on a international level. With the companies amazing development they were allowed to opened up new studios in Rzesz√≥w and Katowice also allowing to open company branches in the UK, Germany, USA and Spain. City Interactive has had an amazing progression and is the fastest developing company in the entire video game business.

City Interactive has also reaped the benefits of cooperating with other companies, including: Atari, Ubisoft, Focus Entertainment, CDV and Mindscape.

As of today City Interactive has nearly 150 employers and has received a "Solidna Firma" ("Trustworthy Company") Certificate three times (in 2005, 2006 and 2007) in a Polish national verification program for promotion of honest and trustworthy business.

The year 2010 was very successful for City Interactive. The Polish company opened a new studio in London, where Stuart Black , an ex-Codemasters employee was appointed as creative director. City also bought license for CryEngine 3.
